detailed_goals: Analyze initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking.
Set weekly targets for improvement in data completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness.
Generate weekly data quality reports to track progress against metrics.
Review EHR system capabilities for influenza data collection.
Communicate hospital's specific requirements for influenza data collection to the EHR vendor.
Discuss necessary system modifications or updates with the EHR vendor.
Finalize modifications to nursing assessment workflow for influenza symptoms.
Update physician examination workflow to include prompts for influenza diagnosis and testing.
Ensure integration between EHR and laboratory information system for automatic result reporting.
Develop data quality checks for influenza-related data.
Implement automated validation rules within the EHR system.
Perform initial data accuracy checks through random chart audits.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely.
Administer influenza vaccinations and document information in the EHR.
Assess current EHR capabilities for influenza data collection.
Develop detailed requirements specifications for necessary EHR system updates.
Consult with the EHR vendor to discuss feasibility of updates.
Develop and distribute initial communication materials for the EHR project.
Schedule and conduct project kick-off announcement.
Establish feedback mechanisms for staff to submit ideas and concerns.
Review existing EHR database schema for influenza data storage.
Design new tables for influenza-related data.
Map specific EHR data elements to corresponding columns in new tables.
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for influenza trend reports.
Determine appropriate data visualization techniques for reports.
Identify data sources for generating influenza trend reports.
Develop training modules for new influenza data collection procedures.
Create comprehensive training materials, including slide presentations and user manuals.
Schedule initial training sessions for nursing staff.
Develop data quality checks for influenza-related data.
Implement automated validation rules within the EHR system.
Perform initial data accuracy checks through random chart audits.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely.
Administer influenza vaccinations and document information in the EHR.

Consult with the EHR vendor to discuss feasibility of updates.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely.
Administer influenza vaccinations and document information in the EHR.
Establish a help desk ticketing system for EHR-related inquiries.
Provide multiple channels for support (phone, email, online portal).
Respond promptly to user inquiries within 1-2 business hours.
Develop a plan for resolving data quality issues related to influenza.
Conduct root cause analysis for identified data quality issues.
Implement corrective actions to address root causes.
Finalize data abstraction protocol and standardized form.
Conduct training session for data abstractors.
Pilot test the data abstraction protocol with a small sample of historical records.
Review project goals and objectives for influenza data collection.
Attend project meetings to provide clinical insights.
Gather feedback from clinical staff on EHR system and data collection processes.
Finalize data abstraction protocol and standardized form.
